P.title: Will a significant political movement or party emerge by 2030, influenced by theories or discoveries related to dark matter?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a political movement or party that explicitly cites theories or discoveries related to dark matter as a significant influence on its platform, policies, or founding principles has emerged and is recognized as significant within its national context. Significance can be determined by any of the following criteria:
- Official recognition as a political party by a national electoral commission or equivalent authority.
- Representation in a national parliament or legislative body.
- Coverage as a significant movement or party by at least three reputable international news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

For the purpose of this question, "dark matter" refers to the astrophysical component thought to constitute most of the matter in the universe, influencing theories of cosmic structure and evolution. Theories or discoveries must be cited in official party documents, public statements by party leaders, or foundational texts.

In the event of ambiguity regarding the movement or party's influence by dark matter theories, the resolution will default to No.

cons_P.title: Will a significant political movement or party emerge by 2030, influenced by scientific theories or discoveries?
cons_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a political movement or party that explicitly cites scientific theories or discoveries as a significant influence on its platform, policies, or founding principles has emerged and is recognized as significant within its national context. Significance can be determined by any of the following criteria:

- Official recognition as a political party by a national electoral commission or equivalent authority.
- Representation in a national parliament or legislative body.
- Coverage as a significant movement or party by at least three reputable international news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

For the purpose of this question, "scientific theories or discoveries" refers to any scientific advancements or theories that have influenced the movement or party's ideology. Theories or discoveries must be cited in official party documents, public statements by party leaders, or foundational texts.

In the event of ambiguity regarding the movement or party's influence by scientific theories or discoveries, the resolution will default to No.

P.title: Will a significant political movement or party emerge by 2030, influenced by theories or discoveries related to dark matter?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a political movement or party that explicitly cites theories or discoveries related to dark matter as a significant influence on its platform, policies, or founding principles has emerged and is recognized as significant within its national context. Significance can be determined by any of the following criteria:
- Official recognition as a political party by a national electoral commission or equivalent authority.

For the purpose of this question, "dark matter" refers to the astrophysical component thought to constitute most of the matter in the universe, influencing theories of cosmic structure and evolution. verification_result.reasoning: If a political movement or party emerges influenced by theories or discoveries related to dark matter, it is also influenced by scientific theories or discoveries, as dark matter theories are a subset of scientific theories. This relationship is due to the broader category of scientific theories encompassing dark matter theories.

P.title: Will the number of golf courses implementing sustainable water management practices increase by 50% by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the number of golf courses worldwide that have implemented sustainable water management practices has increased by at least 50% compared to the number recorded as of January 1, 2021. Sustainable water management practices include, but are not limited to, the use of recycled or reclaimed water, rainwater harvesting systems, efficient irrigation technology, and drought-resistant landscaping. Verification must come from credible sources such as the Global Golf Environment Organization (GEO), the United States Golf Association (USGA), or equivalent national and international bodies. In the absence of comprehensive global data, a representative sample from major golfing countries (USA, UK, Japan, South Korea, and Australia) may be used to infer global trends. The increase must be net, accounting for both new adoptions and any discontinuations of sustainable practices.

cons_P.title: Will the number of golf courses implementing sustainable water management practices increase by 30% by 2030?
cons_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the number of golf courses worldwide that have implemented sustainable water management practices has increased by at least 30% compared to the number recorded as of January 1, 2021. Sustainable water management practices include, but are not limited to, the use of recycled or reclaimed water, rainwater harvesting systems, efficient irrigation technology, and drought-resistant landscaping. Verification must come from credible sources such as the Global Golf Environment Organization (GEO), the United States Golf Association (USGA), or equivalent national and international bodies. In the absence of comprehensive global data, a representative sample from major golfing countries (USA, UK, Japan, South Korea, and Australia) may be used to infer global trends. The increase must be net, accounting for both new adoptions and any discontinuations of sustainable practices.

P.title: Will the number of golf courses implementing sustainable water management practices increase by 50% by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the number of golf courses worldwide that have implemented sustainable water management practices has increased by at least 50% compared to the number recorded as of January 1, 2021. The increase must be net, accounting for both new adoptions and any discontinuations of sustainable practices.

verification_result.reasoning: If the number of golf courses implementing sustainable water management practices increases by 50%, it also increases by 30%. This is due to quantity.

P.title: Will the value of the US dollar significantly influence global renewable energy investments by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is a significant influence of the US dollar value on global renewable energy investments. A "significant influence" is defined as a documented change of at least 10% in the total global investment in renewable energy sources (solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass) directly attributed to fluctuations in the US dollar value. This must be confirmed by data or reports from at least two of the following authoritative sources: International Energy Agency (IEA), World Bank, Bloomberg New Energy Finance, or similar reputable organizations. In the absence of direct reports, credible analyses from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) that link changes in renewable energy investments to the US dollar value will also be considered sufficient. The analysis must clearly differentiate the impact of the US dollar from other factors influencing renewable energy investments.

cons_P.title: Will the value of the US dollar significantly influence global energy investments by 2025?
cons_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is a significant influence of the US dollar value on global energy investments. A "significant influence" is defined as a documented change of at least 10% in the total global investment in energy sources (solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, biomass, fossil fuels, nuclear, etc.) directly attributed to fluctuations in the US dollar value. This must be confirmed by data or reports from at least two of the following authoritative sources: International Energy Agency (IEA), World Bank, Bloomberg New Energy Finance, or similar reputable organizations. In the absence of direct reports, credible analyses from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) that link changes in energy investments to the US dollar value will also be considered sufficient. The analysis must clearly differentiate the impact of the US dollar from other factors influencing energy investments.

P.title: Will the value of the US dollar significantly influence global renewable energy investments by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is a significant influence of the US dollar value on global renewable energy investments. A "significant influence" is defined as a documented change of at least 10% in the total global investment in renewable energy sources (solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass) directly attributed to fluctuations in the US dollar value. This must be confirmed by data or reports from at least two of the following authoritative sources: International Energy Agency (IEA), World Bank, Bloomberg New Energy Finance, or similar reputable organizations. In the absence of direct reports, credible analyses from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) that link changes in renewable energy investments to the US dollar value will also be considered sufficient. The analysis must clearly differentiate the impact of the US dollar from other factors influencing renewable energy investments.

verification_result.reasoning: If the value of the US dollar significantly influences global renewable energy investments, it also influences global energy investments, as renewable energy is a subset of global energy. This relationship is due to quantity, as renewable energy investments are part of the broader category of energy investments.

P.title: Will Microsoft's carbon negative pledge significantly impact global CO2 levels by 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Microsoft's carbon negative pledge has resulted in a measurable and significant reduction in global CO2 levels. A "significant reduction" is defined as a decrease in global CO2 levels by at least 0.1% from 2020 levels, attributable directly to Microsoft's initiatives. This includes, but is not limited to, direct carbon capture and storage efforts, renewable energy investments, and ecosystem restoration projects. The assessment must be confirmed by data from authoritative sources such as the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or the International Energy Agency (IEA). In the absence of direct attribution to Microsoft's efforts, a consensus among at least three reputable scientific publications or environmental organizations is required. The resolution will consider only actions taken by Microsoft up to December 31, 2030, and their impact on CO2 levels by that date. Temporary or reversible actions do not count towards this question's resolution.

cons_P.title: Will Microsoft's carbon negative pledge impact global CO2 levels by 2030?
cons_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Microsoft's carbon negative pledge has resulted in a measurable reduction in global CO2 levels. A "reduction" is defined as a decrease in global CO2 levels from 2020 levels, attributable directly to Microsoft's initiatives. This includes, but is not limited to, direct carbon capture and storage efforts, renewable energy investments, and ecosystem restoration projects. The assessment must be confirmed by data from authoritative sources such as the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or the International Energy Agency (IEA). In the absence of direct attribution to Microsoft's efforts, a consensus among at least three reputable scientific publications or environmental organizations is required. The resolution will consider only actions taken by Microsoft up to December 31, 2030, and their impact on CO2 levels by that date. Temporary or reversible actions do not count towards this question's resolution.

Temporary or reversible actions do not count towards this question's resolution.

verification_result.reasoning: If Microsoft's carbon negative pledge results in a significant reduction in global CO2 levels, it also results in a measurable reduction in global CO2 levels. This is due to quantity, as a significant reduction (at least 0.1%) implies a measurable reduction.

P.title: Will a philosophical breakthrough influence the regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies by 2030?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a philosophical breakthrough (defined as a significant advancement or discovery in ethical, moral, or philosophical reasoning that pertains to digital currencies or assets) directly influences the creation, amendment, or interpretation of regulatory frameworks for cryptocurrencies in any major economy (e.g., G7 countries).

The influence must be explicitly acknowledged by the regulatory body or government in official documentation, announcements, or through legislative history. In the absence of direct acknowledgment, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the philosophical breakthrough's impact on cryptocurrency regulation are sufficient.

The breakthrough must pertain specifically to cryptocurrencies and not general financial regulation. If the influence is part of broader financial regulatory changes, the specific impact on cryptocurrencies must be clearly delineated.

In the event of ambiguous cases, the resolution will consider expert analysis from recognized authorities in philosophy, economics, or law to determine the breakthrough's direct influence on cryptocurrency regulation.

cons_P.title: Will a philosophical breakthrough influence the regulatory framework for digital assets by 2030?
cons_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a philosophical breakthrough (defined as a significant advancement or discovery in ethical, moral, or philosophical reasoning that pertains to digital currencies or assets) directly influences the creation, amendment, or interpretation of regulatory frameworks for digital assets in any major economy (e.g., G7 countries).

The influence must be explicitly acknowledged by the regulatory body or government in official documentation, announcements, or through legislative history. In the absence of direct acknowledgment, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the philosophical breakthrough's impact on digital asset regulation are sufficient.

The breakthrough must pertain specifically to digital assets and not general financial regulation. If the influence is part of broader financial regulatory changes, the specific impact on digital assets must be clearly delineated.

In the event of ambiguous cases, the resolution will consider expert analysis from recognized authorities in philosophy, economics, or law to determine the breakthrough's direct influence on digital asset regulation.

verification_result.reasoning: If a philosophical breakthrough influences the regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies, it also influences the regulatory framework for digital assets, as cryptocurrencies are a subset of digital assets. This is due to quantity.
